The thing is though, that is just your opinion on what the cause of toxicity. It is certainly a factor, I don't see it as that large of a factor. 

Personally Id say the biggest contribute is the snowball nature of the game. Its a doubled edged sword. Its what makes the game so frustrating at times, but its also what makes it so satisfying. This is also what causes many games to be one sided. Which most people blame matchmaking for.

Reducing toxicity also reduces trolling because trolls feed on the reactions. Reacting to trolls reinforces their behavior because it is giving them exactly what they want. If you give a dog a treat every time he shits on the carpet it's gonna keep doing it.

Should Malphite be punished if he's intentionally feeding games? Yes.

Does that mean Dunkey had every right to say he wishes him dead, despite the ToS you agree to every time a patch happens stating you can't? No.

Does being a YouTuber give him the special treatment? No.

Was he a good example of the game? Opinion's for this part, but for me no.

I got nothing against a bit of trash talk. That was no trash talk. If you think what he said was justified, you basically say that it's okay to be as toxic as you want. Not to mention they don't just start off with bans. He has had many chat restrictions before this, and Riot decided he's not going to learn unless they completely lock him away for a while.

Note: I'm not one of the people that downvoted you

If you look at the way that the game handles bans, things start to look a little funny. First, it's basically impossible for someone to get banned from a single game's reports so Dunkey probably had some other reports of toxicity before that game. If this were a first offense or his other reports weren't significant, he'd most likely have received just a chat ban instead of a game ban.

Secondly, the way the game looks at bannable situations changes based on the offense. Chat bans have a lot of automation to them so it's possible that once he was reported the game went through his chat backlogs, looked for key words or scenarios and banned him quickly. Something like intentional feeding can't be scanned in quite the same way as intentional feeding can look a lot like someone having a bad game, so banning them through automation can result in banning people for doing poorly which adds a lot of insult to injury. So intentional feeding almost always needs a human to look at and evaluate the situation which takes more time and typically has more gray area to prevent banning people for trying but failing. 

Bearing in mind that a single game's reports are rather difficult to get banned from, it's possible that if the Malphite in question had no/insignificant previous reports that he'd be able to avoid getting banned from the one game shown. Even if he did have previous reports, it would take more time for him to get banned than Dunkey.

While most people agree that intentional feeding is worse than verbal abuse, both people performed reportable actions and were treated accordingly. Just because one player was banned doesn't mean that the other player automatically meets the criteria for also being banned in regards to their specific offense. Going afk because someone is being verbally abusive means both players should be reported, assisting the enemy team because someone is afk means that both people should be reported, and each case should be treated in isolation to see whether that case combined with their previous cases warrant action.

I think it may be a bit much for him to say that he's not going to be making League videos any more, but I would understand if this left a sour taste in his mouth, causing him to take a League hiatus, upload League less frequently, or only be in League videos via being in other Youtuber's videos as he didn't say he would stop playing, just stop making videos himself.

I find it funny how Riot implements a button to stop toxicity but no one uses it and toxic players are the most banned yet you can't block a troller and they barely get banned. The excuse of "Well you can prove through chat logs that he was toxic but u cant prove a troller" Uhh yes you can. In the video when he dies to Darius you can see the chat log and malphite basically says "I called support bard is dyslexic gave my team ample time to dodge (He wanted someone else to lose LP instead of himself cause he was being a dickhead) they didnt dodge so im feeding, enjoy free win." The chat logs clearly show that this guy had trolling intentions. Also if a guy has 9 deaths pre 15 mins and isnt farming, getting assists, or kills im pretty sure its clear the guy is trolling. 

Now im not saying dunkey is right, he is very wrong and he was toxic but there are a few things we need to address.

1) Riot needs to stop babying their customers, in the real world are you going to go to the police cause someone called you a fucktard? No. 
Im talking about minor toxicity, dunkeys level was beyond bad but if someone says "You are retarded" they shouldn't be banned, sorry but they just shouldn't. 

2) Riot needs to fix their report system drastically. There is a reason over 80% of bans are toxic bans, its because riot doesn't ban anyone else cause they don't  focus on any other type of report besides toxicity.

Thats just my 2 cents.
